speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Marty.  What's that?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's Frasier and Niles's old playpen.  I got it out of storage for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Looks a bit rickety

speaker: Martin
text: No, it just needs a little weight to balance it.  Put a baby in there and it'll be fine _Martin gives it a light tap with his screwdriver -- snap! the sides fold and slam together like the jaws of a bear-trap.  They both gasp. _

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not putting my baby in that deathtrap.

speaker: Daphne
text: And by the way, did you move your gun out to storage like you promised?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm getting to it.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  That gun is still around?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, jeez.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, two years ago I demanded you get rid of it and you said you did.  Don't tell me it's still in your closet.

speaker: Martin
text: No, it's in a shoebox under my bed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't want it here in my apartment.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, all right, it'll go into storage today, but I don't know what we'll do if a burglar breaks in.

speaker: Daphne
text: You could lure him into that playpen. [_to Frasier_] You slept awfully late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm, yeah, oh well, I was having the most distressing dream.  I was climbing up a volcano that was spewing ice instead of lava.

speaker: Daphne
text: An ice volcano -- wonder what that could mean.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what's this? [_pushes playback button_]

speaker: Lilith
text: [_on machine_] Hello, it's Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: We're supposed to be having breakfast, but you're not here.  And as I don't know if you're tardy, or have been in a terrible accident, I'm unable to commit to an appropriate emotional response.  Please call me.  Thank you. [_beep_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh damn, I completely forgot.  Lilith is in town for a one-day conference. [_picks up the phone_] Now I'll have to cancel lunch to see her.

speaker: Martin
text: Can't you catch her on the next trip?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, she'll only be hurt, and of course she'll, she'll dredge it up the next time she needs an emotional trump card.  Ooh!  Maybe I can trick her into canceling lunch on me!

speaker: Daphne
text: Instead of playing games, why don't you just talk to her.

speaker: Frasier
text: We tried talking when we were married.  We were better at games. [_into phone_] Hello, Lilith, it's Frasier.  Gosh, I'm so sorry. I was on my way to breakfast, and, uh... I-I swerved to avoid hitting a Pomeranian, and I-I ran up on the curb and blew a tire. [_Martin and Daphne trade a look_] All right, well, maybe you could come by here for lunch.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covers the phone and whispers_] She won't, she won't. [_into phone_] Okay, then.  All right, see you here around 1:00, okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn - she came to play. _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Apartment Daphne answers the door to Niles. _

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello. [_kisses him_]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.  Hey, do you want to join us for lunch?  We're trying a new Indonesian place.  It's famous for its _Besengek Daging._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, wish I could, but I promised Frasier I'd stay here until he got back from the dentist.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, we'll keep you company. [_sits down_] Why'd he need you to hang around?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_who's gotten her coat_] He's making lunch for Lilith.

speaker: Niles
text: [_gets up_] And off we go!

speaker: Daphne
text: Too late.

speaker: Niles
text: Shouldn't you get the door?

speaker: Martin
text: You're closer.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't live here.

speaker: Martin
text: Doesn't matter, you're family.

speaker: Niles
text: So is Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no you don't!

speaker: Lilith
text: [_from behind the door_] Maybe if you slid me a key, I could let myself in.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Lilith!  Sorry for the hold-up, but Frasier should be back from the dentist any minute.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, all right.  That'll give us a chance to visit.

speaker: Lilith
text: Daphne, Niles, congratulations on the successful commingling of your genetic material.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.

speaker: Lilith
text: Do you know the sex?

speaker: Niles
text: Do we?  That's how we got pregnant!

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: No, we're-we're... we're gonna let it be a surprise.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, okay.

speaker: Daphne
text: Please sit down.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, if I was to guess the gender [_with a little smirk_] -- and I'm usually right about half the time... I'm being humorous, of course.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!

speaker: Lilith
text: I would say it's a boy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, what makes you say that?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, it's highly unscientific, but the proverbial old wives would cite the spreading of your nose, the unevenness of your breasts, and the coarse black hair on your legs.

speaker: Daphne
text: Interesting... [_to Martin_] Is that the shoebox from under your bed, then?

speaker: Lilith
text: Excuse me. [_into phone_] Hello?  Yes, Frasier.  Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.

speaker: Martin
text: [_quickly_] Hear what?  He's still coming, isn't he?

speaker: Lilith
text: [_into phone_] Yes, all right, all right.  I'll meet you then, bye. [_hangs up_] Frasier can't make it.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh... well, if you still want lunch, I got leftover meatloaf that's today or never.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you, but I'll get something at the conference. [_gets her coat_] There's a bulimia talk today, and I'll wager that's one lecture hall with a snack machine outside. [_goes to the door_] Lovely to see you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Bye-bye.

speaker: Daphne
text: Did you hear what she said about me?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: That I've got a flat nose, uneven boobs, and bristly legs?  I mean, are they really that bad? [_stands and lifts her skirt to get a closer look_]

speaker: Martin
text: Not bad.  Maybe a little cock-eyed, but with a heavy sweater you could...

speaker: Daphne
text: I was talking about my legs! [_then_] Oh, forget about lunch. I'm just going to make a sandwich.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, hey... what about me?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, have a banana. _She tosses a banana at him.  He grabs it against his chest, fumbling, and stumbles backwards over the kitchen table, knocking the shoebox onto the floor.  BANG!  The gun goes off, and everyone jumps._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_coming out_] My God, what was that?!

speaker: Niles
text: I think the banana went off.

speaker: Martin
text: You knocked my gun on the floor.  Is everyone all right?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, are you all right?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I'm fine.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, you okay?

speaker: Martin
text: [_picking it up_] Yeah, I'm fine.  I don't understand this.  I thought the safety was on.

speaker: Niles
text: [_notices_] Oh my God!  It blew a hole through Frasier's chair!

speaker: Martin
text: [_notices_] And it shot the head off the statue! _Exhibit B: the African figurine on the stereo cabinet has been decapitated. Martin picks up the head off the floor._

speaker: Niles
text: [_running over_] Look what it did to the fireplace! _Exhibit C: a ragged hole in the middle of a long crack in one of the tiles above the fireplace._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh no, Frasier's going to kill me!

speaker: Daphne
text: This is why I've been telling you to put the bloody thing in storage!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles was the one who knocked it off the table!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, accidentally, because I had a banana thrown at me!

speaker: Daphne
text: To you, not at you!  And you should know how to catch a banana!

speaker: Niles
text: I am not having this argument again!

speaker: Martin
text: If Frasier sees this, I'll never hear the end of it.  You guys have got to help me fix things up before he gets home.

speaker: Daphne
text: Forget it, old man.  You're on your own.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, well, if he kicks me out over this, I'm moving in with you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_immediately_] All right, what's the plan?

speaker: Martin
text: You start calling upholsterers.  Niles, get me some spackle. [_Niles runs to the hallway_] I'll see if I can Krazy Glue the head back on that thing. _He goes to the desk to find the glue.  Niles halts his run, and runs back to Martin._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, Dad... what's spackle? _Martin rolls his eyes as he continues to look through the drawer.  FADE OUT  Scene Three -- Cafe Nervosa Lilith is having coffee with a colleague, Nancy. _

speaker: Lilith
text: Anyway, long story short, six months in, he tells me I'm "too tightly wound."  Me.

speaker: Nancy
text: Wow, I don't know what to tell you, Lil.

speaker: Lilith
text: Lilith.  My name is Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, my beeper. [_reads it_] Oh darn, they need me back at the conference. [_gets up_]

speaker: Nancy
text: Okay, but listen, we all have bad dating experiences, so don't give up.  Get out there, have fun, meet people.

speaker: Lilith
text: You're right.  Thank you, Nancy.  You're a real pal.  And the best survivor guilt and phantom limb expert in the game.

speaker: Lilith
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Roz
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_stops_] Roz... Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes...?  Oh hi, Lilith.  What are you doing in town?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, I'm here for a conference, and was supposed to meet Frasier here for coffee, but I'm afraid I have to leave.  Will you tell him I'll call him later?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure, no problem.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: Bye-bye.

speaker: Roz
text: Can I have change for the meter?

speaker: Barista
text: Only if you buy something.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, I can't, I don't have time, the Meter Maid's coming.

speaker: Barista
text: Sorry, can't do it.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, someone doesn't want his tip very much.

speaker: Barista
text: You haven't ordered anything.

speaker: Roz
text: I meant the tip I gave you yesterday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier. [_stops and turns back_] Oh, um, Lilith had to leave. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, damn!  Again?

speaker: Barista
text: Can I help you?

speaker: Nancy/Frasier
text: Yes.../Yes, I'd like to have...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm terribly sorry.  Please, go ahead.

speaker: Nancy
text: No, that's all right, you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I insist.  After you.

speaker: Nancy
text: We'll go together.  What are you having?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, uh, a macchiato for here.

speaker: Nancy
text: One macchiato for here, and a mocha Valencia to go, please. [_to Frasier_] Macchiato man.  Don't meet many of those.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, we're a, a rare breed.  Spartan... rugged...

speaker: Barista
text: [_setting it on the counter_] You like a dusting of nutmeg on that, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a sprinkle. [_to Nancy_] So, is this your first time here?

speaker: Nancy
text: Yeah, I'm in town on business.  First time in Seattle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, then that entitles you to a complimentary beverage. These are on me.

speaker: Nancy
text: Thank you. [_gets an idea_] Tell me, is there a Mrs. Macchiato?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckles_] No.

speaker: Nancy
text: This may sound a little crazy, but would you be interested in having a drink later with a friend of mine?  I think you might really hit it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it sounds intriguing.

speaker: Nancy
text: [_writes her number on a card_] I'm late for a meeting, but if you're game, let's just say 7:00 at the Marina Tavern.  And if you change your mind, here's my number.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes it_] All right, then.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, have you ever been set up on a date with someone whose name you didn't know?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh please, I've woken up with dates whose names I didn't know. [_to the Barista_] Cappuccino, please.  What's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I just met this woman who's in town on business.  She asked me to join a friend of hers for a drink at the Marina Tavern.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh... well you know, there is no friend.  The woman you met is the woman you're meeting.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's what I thought.  I wonder why she wouldn't give me her name?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, when you're in town on business and you hook up with a stranger, no names is standard procedure.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not sure that's something you want to admit knowing, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: I only know it from reading Erica Jong novels, okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not sure that's something you want to admit either. _She gives him a look as we FADE OUT.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- Apartment Martin is carefully applying glue to the figurine, whose head has been replaced.  As the door opens, he hides it with his arm, but it is only Daphne with a shopping bag. _

speaker: Daphne
text: I got the spackle.

speaker: Niles
text: Good, good, we'll fill in the crack, then my faux finisher can match the stone.  Fabrizio is on his way to re-upholster.  Dad, how are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: Great.  This glue should hold it just fine.  But your guys better get over here soon.  Frasier's meeting Lilith after work at the cafe, which only gives us...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s., from the hallway_] Oh, hello, Mrs. Richman.

speaker: Daphne
text: Shh!  Frasier! _As they rush to cover up the damage, the head teeters off the figurine. Niles yelps and grabs it, holding it in place.  As Daphne throws herself into the damaged chair, Martin holds his arm over the crack and rests his hand on the wall.  Frasier enters and takes in the scene: Niles resting a hand on the head of the statue, Daphne seated facing him, and Martin's arm high above his head on the wall -- all three trying to look casual. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all.  What's going on?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, just admiring the sunset.

speaker: Martin
text: I think it looks best over here, but Niles thinks it looks best over there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really? [_notices Niles's hand on the statue_] Oh, Niles, have you changed your mind about my new statue?  Yesterday you said it was sterile and unmoving.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's moving now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'd love to stay and gloat, but I have a very intriguing date for which I must get ready.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, good luck with that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad. [_notices another message_] Oh, what's this? [_presses button_]

speaker: Lilith
text: [_on machine_] Frasier, I'm just leaving the cafe.  Sorry I missed you.  Anyway, if you're available for a drink, I'm staying at the Harbor View.  Call me. [_beep_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear... damn!  I've got an exciting mystery date, and who should rear her head at the last minute but Lilith!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, if you leave right away, you'd probably have time for a quick drink with Lilith and then still make it for your date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good thinking, Dad!  I can dispense with the pleasantries and be on my way! _He runs down the hallway, and all three break their pose.  Martin bows over in pain from being stretched upwards, while Niles-_

speaker: Niles
text: Help me, help me!  The head is stuck to my hand! _Daphne grabs his arm and rips the head loose, making him scream.  As they converge in the middle of the room-_

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s., coming back_] You know, on second thought... _They scramble to re-cover the exhibits.  When Frasier comes in, Daphne's hand is on the statue, Martin is in the chair, and Niles has his arm flung up over the fireplace.  All three are craning their necks to look out the window._

speaker: Frasier
text: ...maybe I should invite Lilith here so that I can have more time to get ready.

speaker: Martin/Daphne/Niles
text: ** No!

speaker: Daphne
text: She's already been here once.  You should go to her.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're quite right -- but, then, should I change or am I fine the way I am?

speaker: Niles/Martin
text: ** Fine/Oh, hubba-hubba!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gets his coat_] Well then, I'll just see you all later. _As he goes out the door, Martin starts to straighten up, but as Frasier turns around curiously, Martin leans back again._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, you're right, it's a much, much different sunset from here. _Frasier, still a little puzzled, exits.  FADE OUT_ **FIX UP MIX UP** _Scene Five -- Lilith's hotel room Lilith is seated on the couch, wearing a nice evening dress and talking on her room's cordless phone. _

speaker: Lilith
text: [_her usual flat monotone_] Yes, of course I'm excited, Nancy.  Can't you hear it in the timbre of my voice?  Yes well, I'm afraid I might be a little bit late, I'm still waiting for my ex-husband.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, there he is.  Look, I'll get through this as quickly as I possibly can.  Yes, all right, bye. _She hangs up and opens the door to Frasier.  Throughout the following dialogue, both are eager to leave and concealing it badly._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Lilith. [_kisses her cheek_] I'm sorry I'm late.  Traffic was a bear.  It's good to see you.

speaker: Lilith
text: Likewise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, I'm sorry about all the missed connections today, but at least we have a chance to catch up, however briefly.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes well, sometimes with old friends, five minutes is enough.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ha!  One minute!

speaker: Lilith
text: So, care for a drink?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not if I'm keeping you from something.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, actually, I do have a date this evening.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes.  A colleague of mine fixed me up.  I'm sorry for dragging you over here when I have so little time to give you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not at all.  Actually, I'm running late for a date myself.

speaker: Lilith
text: I see.  Well, why don't you run along?  I wouldn't want you to keep Niles waiting.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] No.  It is with a woman -- a very vibrant, sexy woman.

speaker: Lilith
text: Ah.  Good for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, listen, if you're running late, and you need to cancel our drink...

speaker: Lilith
text: No, no, no, I've canceled on you once already today...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I canceled on you twice, that would make us even.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_pouring_] That's why we're having the drink.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Lilith
text: Unless you're worried that your sexy date will leave if you're five minutes late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, not at all.  My absence will only make her heart grow fonder.  You mind if I use the bathroom?

speaker: Lilith
text: Certainly. _Frasier exits to the bathroom.  CUT TO: Bathroom  Frasier sits down on the toilet and dials his mobile._

speaker: Frasier
text: Please don't leave, please don't leave, please don't leave... [_into phone_] Hello?  Miss Mocha Valencia?  Yes, Macchiato Man here.  Uh, listen, I'm glad I caught you. _CUT TO: Nancy's hotel room. She is sitting on a couch reading some papers as she's taking Frasier's call._

speaker: Nancy
text: Hi, where are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh well, something's come up and I'm afraid I have to--

speaker: Nancy
text: Oh wait, I have another call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.

speaker: Nancy
text: Hello? _The screen view shunts to the right, now putting Nancy on the left and Lilith (on her own cell phone) on the right._

speaker: Lilith
text: Nancy, it's Lilith again.  Listen, this thing with my ex-husband is taking a lot longer than I expected.  But I will be there, I promise you.

speaker: Nancy
text: Uh-oh.

speaker: Lilith
text: What do you mean "uh-oh"?

speaker: Nancy
text: Well, I'm on the other line with your date right now, and... I think he wants to cancel.

speaker: Lilith
text: Before he's even met me?  Well, uh... tell him I canceled on him first!

speaker: Nancy
text: Okay.  I'm really sorry about this, Lilith. [_switches lines again_]

speaker: Nancy
text: Hi.  So, I'm afraid tonight's off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Off?

speaker: Nancy
text: Yeah, that was my friend.  She had second thoughts.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?  Well, please tell your "friend" that I wasn't exactly bowled over by her first thoughts!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't even know what that means. _CUT TO: Hotel Room  As Frasier comes out, Lilith holds out one of two glasses._

speaker: Lilith
text: So what would you say to that drink?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd say, "don't get too comfortable in that glass."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this is nice.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, very. _They sit in chairs at opposite ends of the table.  They are still awkward with each other._

speaker: Frasier
text: Freddy tells me he dissected a frog.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, and a fetal pig.  Of course, I made him do his homework first.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith, you seem preoccupied.  Is this about your blind date tonight?

speaker: Lilith
text: You could say that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, for what it's worth, whoever this guy is... he'll feel awfully lucky when you walk through the door.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you, Frasier - but I really shouldn't be keeping you from your date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, right.  Well, I guess I should be going, yes. _He stands and makes a show of reaching for his coat, but can't face an evening alone -- though he can't yet confess the truth to her. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Although, you know, you are here for just one night.  Perhaps I could call and push things back a bit?

speaker: Lilith
text: Maybe I could delay mine as well.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.

speaker: Lilith
text: All right.

speaker: Lilith
text: What excuse are you going to use?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'll just trot out my stand-by, it works every time.  Simply say that I swerved to avoid hitting a Chihuahua, ran up on a curb and blew a tire.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_amused_] This morning you said it was a Pomeranian.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_embarrassed_] Well, this morning it was. _But by now they are over the awkwardness and easy in each other's company.  FADE OUT_ **THINGS THAT GO HUMP IN THE NIGHT** _Scene Six -- Lilith's hotel room Frasier and Lilith are seated on the couch together, with drinks.  They have been comparing track records. _

speaker: Frasier
text: So I'm in the middle of this date from hell, when Kenny walks in with his cousin, whom I'd passed on sight unseen.  Turns out she's not only gorgeous, but her name is actually Miss Wright.

speaker: Lilith
text: Okay, you win.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm-hmm.  [_N.B. See[[11.05]](/frasier/transcripts/season_11/episode_5/the_placeholder.html "The Placeholder"), The Placeholder_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, are there any more kettle chips in the mini-bar?

speaker: Lilith
text: No.  We can have either Gummi Bears or cashews, but I'm afraid we can't afford both.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah. _They share a bemused smile.  Then in the adjoining room they hear a door slam._

speaker: Sean
text: [_o.s._] Erin, would you stop?  I don't even know what I did!

speaker: Erin
text: [_o.s._] Why do you always say that like you think it will help?

speaker: Sean
text: Because when I guess, you get angrier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Boy, that takes you back, doesn't it?

speaker: Sean
text: What, did I forget to notice your hair?

speaker: Erin
text: That's NOT why I'm mad.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm just going to ask them to be quiet.

speaker: Sean
text: I can't talk to you when you're like this.  I'm going out.

speaker: Erin
text: Sean, what are you doing?

speaker: Sean
text: [_sees Frasier_] Oh, uh... sorry.

speaker: Erin
text: [_appears behind him; scathingly_] That's not the hall.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, uh... it's all right.  You see, we overheard your quarrel, and in the interest of keeping the peace and quiet, maybe we could offer some assistance.

speaker: Sean
text: No, it's okay, we can handle it ourselves. [_turns away_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_in his element_] Oh, can you, Sean?  You don't even know what you did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, won't you come in? [_they do, hesitantly_] I'm Dr. Frasier Crane, this is Dr. Lilith Sternin.  We are psychiatrists.

speaker: Lilith
text: There's no need to be afraid.  We are here to help.

speaker: Erin
text: So what, you're like caped crusaders for mental health?

speaker: Lilith
text: No, not caped.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, come and sit down. _Sean and Erin sit together on the couch.  Frasier and Lilith take a chair on either side of them._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right then.  What seems to be the problem?

speaker: Erin
text: Uh... when we were at dinner, he was checking out another woman.

speaker: Lilith
text: And you feel threatened by this?

speaker: Erin
text: Shouldn't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe.  Shot in the dark here -- your parents are divorced, Dad left Mom?

speaker: Erin
text: [_surprised_] Yeah.  How'd you know?

speaker: Lilith
text: It's classic transference.  Because your father and mother split up, you overreact whenever you perceive a threat to your current relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Sean_] And you, you care about this woman?

speaker: Sean
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then keep your eyes in your head!  It bugs her, and it's bad form.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_to Erin_] And if he should fail at this -- which he will, he's a man -- it does not mean he's going to leave you.

speaker: Sean
text: Or that I don't love you. [_Erin turns to him_] Because I do.

speaker: Erin
text: [_melting_] I know.  I love you, too.

speaker: Sean
text: Wow!  You guys are good.

speaker: Erin
text: Yeah, that was amazing.  So, do you two just have the best marriage ever?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually...

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes... we do.

speaker: Sean
text: Well, uh, thank you!  It was really nice meeting you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaking his hand_] Likewise, likewise.  You seem like a really nice young couple, and I'm sure you'll understand if I lock the door. Good night.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well done, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Back at you, Dr. Sternin.  I'd suggest that we try a high-five, but I recall we attempted that once after a bridge victory and you scratched my cornea.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, I guess we shouldn't keep our dates waiting any longer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good luck on your-your romantic adventure this evening.  Don't you worry -- you're going to knock his socks off...

speaker: Lilith
text: [_tired out_] Frasier, I don't have a date anymore.  He canceled.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're kidding.

speaker: Lilith
text: No.  I was too proud to admit it to you.  How pathetic is that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's no need to beat yourself up about it.

speaker: Lilith
text: Come on, a fake phone call to "buy time"?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's understandable.  Just a face-saving gesture in the light of...

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh my God, your date canceled on you too.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_caught_] All right, yes.  It's a banner day for both of us. [_drops his coat_] I tell you, all this lying has certainly worked up my appetite.  You want to get some room service?

speaker: Lilith
text: That might be nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay. _She rises from her chair and sits next to him on the couch, as he opens the room service menu._

speaker: Frasier
text: Certainly beats sitting alone, wondering what we missed out on this evening, hmm? _From the next room they hear rhythmic pounding and loud moaning, as Sean and Erin celebrate being reconciled._

speaker: Sean
text: [_o.s._] Yes, yes, yes...!

speaker: Erin
text: [_o.s._] You big-bad-boy...! _Frasier and Lilith sigh and study the menu.  FADE OUT  Scene Seven -- Lilith's hotel room The morning sunlight is coming in.  Frasier and Lilith are lying asleep on the couch, with her head resting in the crook of his arm.  The remains of a gourmet meal and a bottle of wine are on the table before them, and the television is on.  Frasier's jacket is off, but otherwise both are still dressed as before. They have not slept together, but have enjoyed a quiet, intimate evening. Lilith is the first to wake. _

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_wakes_] Hmm?  Hmm... oh!  Oh, gosh, I'm sorry.  Oh, I must have dozed off during the movie.

speaker: Lilith
text: Me too.  What time is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_checks his watch_] Uh, it's almost six.

speaker: Lilith
text: Six?  I have a 7:30 flight. _She gets up and starts straightening the room and gathering her things to pack.  Frasier picks up his coat and goes to the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right.  Well, I'll just get out of your hair.  Listen, Lilith, dinner was lovely last night.  I had a great time.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes well, much better than those blind dates could have possibly been.

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely.  Well listen, have a safe trip and all that, and give Freddy a hug for me.

speaker: Lilith
text: I will.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's funny...

speaker: Lilith
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was just thinking that if we had never met, we're exactly the kind of people that somebody might set up on a blind date.

speaker: Lilith
text: You always were one for droll hypotheticals.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckles_] Ah, yes.  It's amusing to consider though, you know? What would we think of each other if were just meeting now for the first time?

speaker: Lilith
text: But if we hadn't met, we'd be different people now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, true.  But then that raises many other questions.  I mean, what sort of man would the non-Lilith Frasier be?  What sort of woman...?

speaker: Lilith
text: [_coming over_] Did I mention I have a plane to catch?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Lilith
text: But you're right.  It was a lovely evening.

speaker: Frasier
text: We do have our baggage, don't we?  But then sometimes that's what makes the trip so interesting.

speaker: Lilith
text: With one hand the past moves us forward, and with the other it holds us back. _They hug.  Though they are no longer in love, they still share a bond as something closer than best friends._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good-bye, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Good-bye, Frasier. _He calls the elevator.  Lilith looks at him thoughtfully, but not regretfully, and closes the door.  He looks back with the same expression, and then steps onto the elevator.  END OF ACT TWO_
